content:
• Friday, October 12, 2012
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -14.4%) added to its losses after S&P put its BB- debt rating on watch for a...

    AMD (AMD -14.4%) added to its losses after S&P put its BB- debt rating on watch for a possible downgrade in response to its Q3 warning. S&P believes AMD's leverage ratio will remain above 3x (up from 2.4x at the end of Q2), and thinks its cash balance is likely to deteriorate. Also, earlier today, Digitimes claimed AMD's new Z-60 (Hondo) notebook/tablet CPU hasn't seen much traction with PC OEMs, as Intel's Clover Trail scores numerous design wins. AMD had over $2B in debt as of June 30, along with $1.7B in cash/investments. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM

  • InVivo Therapeutics' (NVIV +18.6%) CEO tells shareholders the drug company's stock is...

    InVivo Therapeutics' (NVIV +18.6%) CEO tells shareholders the drug company's stock is undervalued following a recent drop, and he expects the next six months to mark a "major inflection point" in growth. He expects FDA approval to start a study for the use of NVIV's biopolymer scaffolding to treat spinal cord injuries.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • BKS

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -4.7%) dip with word out that the iPad Mini will be unleashed...

    Shares of Barnes & Noble (BKS -4.7%) dip with word out that the iPad Mini will be unleashed later this month to round off the intense competition in the tablet space. While the company remains optimistic on the prospects for its digital bookstore, the first step is bringing more customers into the B&N ecosystem. (compact tablet specs)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • KYTH

    Kythera Biopharmaceuticals (KYTH -2.2%) may be giving back a little today, but the stock is...

    Kythera Biopharmaceuticals (KYTH -2.2%) may be giving back a little today, but the stock is still holding steady above yesterdays IPO debut. The company sold 4.4M shares - 10% more than expected - and the $70.4M deal priced at the top of its range. The stock opened for trading yesterday at $18.49, up 16% from it's $16 offer price, and has held steady throughout both yesterday and today's sessions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • LQDT

    Online auctioneer Liquidity Services (LQDT -9.9%) is cut to Neutral with a $46 price target...

    Online auctioneer Liquidity Services (LQDT -9.9%) is cut to Neutral with a $46 price target (from $62) by BAML, which sees Street sentiment deteriorating given LQDT's recent strong quarterly beats. Weaker-than-expected Sept. GMV results suggest LQDT will report slower volume growth, the firm says, likely coming in near the bottom of its $230M-$240M Q3 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • MMR

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR +4.8%) shares are strong today on no apparent news; MMR declared...

    McMoRan Exploration (MMR +4.8%) shares are strong today on no apparent news; MMR declared quarterly cash dividends on its preferred stocks, but the common shares had surged well before the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 4 Comments
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD +2.9%) and Stratasys (SSYS +4.1%) rally after Piper upgrades 3D to Neutral. Over...

    3D Systems (DDD +2.9%) and Stratasys (SSYS +4.1%) rally after Piper upgrades 3D to Neutral. Over the last 2 months, the 3D printer makers have been digesting the huge gains they saw earlier this year. (3D Systems/Rapidform)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM | 9 Comments
  • LXU

    LSB Industries (LXU -8.9%) shares are pummeled after warning yesterday about Q3 production and...

    LSB Industries (LXU -8.9%) shares are pummeled after warning yesterday about Q3 production and profitability issues. Problems with the ammonia conversion process at two facilities and unplanned downtime at its main ammonia plant resulted in total Q3 ammonia production of ~28K tons, 50% lower than the targeted rate.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -18.3%) plunges to a mere $1.52 after telling the SEC it "cannot currently...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -18.3%) plunges to a mere $1.52 after telling the SEC it "cannot currently estimate the exact filing date" for its FQ2 (August quarter) 10-Q. Shares are now down 51% since OCZ stated on Wednesday it would delay filing its 10-Q, while warning revenue would be well below guidance. During an earnings call discussing the mess, new CEO Ralph Schmitt said management tried to "grow market share at all cost" in FQ2, something that led to a major gross margin hit.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 6 Comments
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -3.2%) completes the contribution of its oil and gas interests in the...

    Gulfport Energy (GPOR -3.2%) completes the contribution of its oil and gas interests in the Permian Basin to Diamondback Energy, which prices its IPO at $17.50/share. If the contribution transaction had closed on Sept. 30, D-back believes it would have owed GPOR ~$16M for the post-closing adjustment, but the actual amount due based on Oct. 11 may vary materially from that amount.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • NINE-OLD

    Midday top 10 gainers: NINE-OLD +62%. CRMB +16%. NPSP +15%. AEGR +13%. GLUU +12%. LXRX +11%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: NINE-OLD +62%. CRMB +16%. NPSP +15%. AEGR +13%. GLUU +12%. LXRX +11%. TSON +11%. BIOF +10%. EMAN +10%. BSDM +9%.
    Top 10 Losers: AEZS -24%. OCZ -17%. TZOO -14%. OTC:PURE -11%. INVE -11%. AMD -10%. LQDT -10%. CCCL -9%. INFY -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +12.1%) jumps to $3.21 on news VC firm GGV Capital, which has a partner on...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +12.1%) jumps to $3.21 on news VC firm GGV Capital, which has a partner on Glu's board, has bought 3.24M shares over the last 3 days at an average price of $3.05. Glu fell 25% on Tuesday and Wednesday thanks disappointment over the performance of Q3 game launches (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • NPSP

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP 14.3%) pops today after it says the FDA has released the briefing...

    NPS Pharmaceuticals (NPSP 14.3%) pops today after it says the FDA has released the briefing documents ahead of its October 16 Advisory Committee meeting for NPSP's experimental drug Gattex, which is being developed for the treatment of adults with short bowel syndrome. The overall comments appear to be positive, with no serious safety issues raised. The advisers also said access to the drug should not be restricted, nor will it require additional elements to assure it's safe use.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • TRLG

    True Religion (TRLG) won't catch a premium price in a takeover, according to a report filtering...

    True Religion (TRLG) won't catch a premium price in a takeover, according to a report filtering out fom dealReporter. Shares have trickled lower off the chatter, but still remain at elevated levels compared to before Wednesday's announcement from the company on a potential sale.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR 12.1%) is flying this morning after Capstone initiates the shares...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR 12.1%) is flying this morning after Capstone initiates the shares with a Buy. The coverage comes on the back of last week's initiation at Overweight by JPMorgan, and just ahead of an FDA advisory meeting scheduled for October 17 - 18 to debate the risks and benefits of AEGR's experimental drug Lomitapide NDA, for the treatment of homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia. The advisory panel recommendations often heavily influence FDA approval decisions.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • AMD

    While AMD (AMD -10.2%) is touching levels last seen in early '09 following its Q3 warning, Intel...

    While AMD (AMD -10.2%) is touching levels last seen in early '09 following its Q3 warning, Intel (INTC -0.2%) and Nvidia (NVDA -0.8%) haven't moved much: the Street is making it clear it views a lot of AMD's problems as company-specific. "AMD’s competitive position is so much weaker than in the past," says Evercore's Patrick Wang, no stranger to criticizing the company. SA's Ashraf Easaa thinks CEO Rory Read, whose 14-month reign has been quite tumultuous, now faces intense scrutiny.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 9 Comments
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +1.6%) says new data from Phase III studies evaluating its experimental...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB +1.6%) says new data from Phase III studies evaluating its experimental multiple-sclerosis pill BG-12 showed strong clinical and positive radiological effects in people with relapsing-remitting MS. The data was presented at the 28th Congress of the European Committee for the Treatment and Research of Multiple Sclerosis in Lyon, France.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 2 Comments
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT -7%) slides after Nomura cuts its price target in half (to $35 from $70) for...

    Walter Energy (WLT -7%) slides after Nomura cuts its price target in half (to $35 from $70) for the coal producer while lowering its 2013 benchmark coking coal view to $185metric ton from $220 and its 2014 forecast to $195/metric ton from $200. The firm says WLT has significant EPS leverage to coal price movements, with every $10 equating to $1.35 of annual EPS impact.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM | 2 Comments
  • JIVE

    Jive Software (JIVE -3%) comes within a hair's breadth of its post-IPO low after BMO downgrades...

    Jive Software (JIVE -3%) comes within a hair's breadth of its post-IPO low after BMO downgrades shares to Market Perform: the firm says checks indicate enterprises are taking a more cautious view of private social networking platforms. That could also be a negative for Salesforce.com (NYSE:CRM), which has lofty ambitions for its Chatter social networking solution, now integrated with many other Salesforce products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • ELOQ

    Eloqua (ELOQ -3%) slips following ExactTarget's (ET-OLD +0.8%) acquisitions of Web marketing...

    Eloqua (ELOQ -3%) slips following ExactTarget's (ET-OLD +0.8%) acquisitions of Web marketing software firms Pardot and iGoDigital. The Pardot deal could be especially weighing on Eloqua, since it leaves ExactTarget better-positioned to compete against Eloqua's cloud-based marketing automation software platform.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • AEZS

    More on Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -22%): Shares are getting slammed even further this morning after...

    More on Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -22%): Shares are getting slammed even further this morning after pricing a total of 6.6M units at $2.50, a 20% discount to Thursday's close. Each unit consists of one common share and 0.45 of a warrant to buy one common share at a purchase price of $2.50 per unit and an exercise price of $3.45 a share for five years. Roth Capital was the sole book runner.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • ULTI

    Ultimate Software (ULTI +3.5%) and Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +2.3%), both the subjects of...

    Ultimate Software (ULTI +3.5%) and Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +2.3%), both the subjects of occasional M&A speculation, are moving higher following cloud HR peer Workday's memorable IPO. Ultimate is also benefiting from ThinkEquity's decision to start coverage with a Buy and $116 target.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • SUN

    Susser Petroleum Partners (SUSP +1.3%) is lauded by Jim Cramer as an ideal dividend stock to...

    Susser Petroleum Partners (SUSP +1.3%) is lauded by Jim Cramer as an ideal dividend stock to hold for the long term. SUSP yields 7.2% and generates revenues through long-term fee-based contracts, and boasts significant market share in Texas and plenty of room to grow, CEO Sam Susser says on Mad Money.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • WDAY

    Workday (NYSE:WDAY) doesn't disappoint. Shares opened at $48.05 and are currently trading at...

    Workday (NYSE:WDAY) doesn't disappoint. Shares opened at $48.05 and are currently trading at $48.17, up 72% from a raised IPO price of $28. The gives the company, declared by some to be the future of enterprise-class HR software, a valuation of $7.7B, or 34x trailing sales. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 7 Comments
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +9.9%) rallies again on expectations the carrier will be acquired at a decent...

    Clearwire (CLWR +9.9%) rallies again on expectations the carrier will be acquired at a decent premium to recent levels, as part of a SoftBank/Sprint tie-up. Shares are now up 92% over the last 2 days. Sprint (S -1.8%) is edging lower following yesterday's big gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • WIT

    Wipro (WIT -2.4%) slips following Infosys' (INFY -10.2%) revenue miss and guidance cut. Infosys'...

    Wipro (WIT -2.4%) slips following Infosys' (INFY -10.2%) revenue miss and guidance cut. Infosys' margin decline is stoking fears about the impact of rising wages on the Indian IT outsourcing space, and its soft deal activity also isn't going over well. Western peers such as IBM and Dell have also been seeing outsourcing demand slump, thanks to macro issues and the growing popularity of cloud services.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics (STM +8.2%) is thinking of breaking itself up, sources tell Bloomberg. The...

    STMicroelectronics (STM +8.2%) is thinking of breaking itself up, sources tell Bloomberg. The company's analog chip business could be split up from its digital chip business, which is heavily exposed to the soft TV and set-top box markets, and mobile baseband chip JV ST-Ericsson, reported this week to be exploring "strategic options," might be sold. Samsung, which has been increasing its mobile chip exposure, is named as a potential buyer for struggling ST-Ericsson.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) -17% after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $35M-$35.5M and EPS of...

    Travelzoo (NASDAQ:TZOO) -17% after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $35M-$35.5M and EPS of $0.20-$0.22, below a consensus of $38.9M and $0.27. The travel deals providers says its hotel search and group-buying voucher solutions aren't "meeting the needs of hotels and users well enough," and is in active talks to buy a hotel bookings site to shore up its offerings. Some online travel names are adding to yesterday's losses. PCLN -1.4%. EXPE -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • DLTR

    Shares of Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) lose 2.6% in premarket trading after taking on downgrades...

    Shares of Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) lose 2.6% in premarket trading after taking on downgrades from Jefferies (to Hold) and Piper Jaffray (to Neutral). Yesterday, the company rattled discounting names across the board after it issued conservative growth estimates at its investor conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) -3.1% and Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) -2.8% after receiving downgrades to...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) -3.1% and Western Digital (NYSE:WDC) -2.8% after receiving downgrades to Sell from Citi. The cheaply-valued hard drive makers have fared better this year than some other names with strong PC exposure, but have still sold off in recent weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM | 2 Comments
  • NPSP

    Premarket gainers: NPSP +11%. CTIC +9%. STM +8%.Losers: AEZS -24%. AMD -11%. INFY -7%.

    Premarket gainers: NPSP +11%. CTIC +9%. STM +8%.
    Losers: AEZS -24%. AMD -11%. INFY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) up 8.5% premarket as it announces the closing of its $60M...

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) up 8.5% premarket as it announces the closing of its $60M convertible preferred stock offering. The company got about $55.6M after expenses; each share of the Series 17 Preferred is convertible into about 714 shares of common stock at a $1.40/share conversion price. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 2 Comments
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA) +3% premarket after pricing its previously announced concurrent public...

    Penn Virginia (PVA) +3% premarket after pricing its previously announced concurrent public offering of 8M shares ($40M) of its common stock at $5/share and 1M ($100M) depositary shares at $100/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM
  • GNK

    Shipping stocks continue to suffer as forecasts for shipments of coal and iron ore are revised...

    Shipping stocks continue to suffer as forecasts for shipments of coal and iron ore are revised lower with China and Europe showing demand below expectations. After making an impressive run in Q1, the Guggenheim Shipping ETF (NYSEARCA:SEA) is now off over 15% for the following two quarters. Despite the malaise, analysts see some light at the end of the tunnel for 2013 as lower capacity helps support pricing in the sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Coal miners Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) and Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) are -2.3% and -1.4%...

    Coal miners Alpha Natural Resources (ANR) and Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU) are -2.3% and -1.4% premarket after they're nailed by downgrades at Nomura. ANRis cut to Neutral from Buy as the firm sees more significant earnings and free cash flow risks than expected, while BTU is cut to Reduce to reflect more conservative forward multiples given elevated earnings risk and weaker growth rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM | 12 Comments
  • LXRX

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) +12.5% premarket after revealing positive top-line results...

    Lexicon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:LXRX) +12.5% premarket after revealing positive top-line results from a midstage study for telotristat etiprate, its investigational new drug to treat carcinoid syndrome. The drug currently has fast track status and orphan drug designation from the FDA, and orphan drug designation from European regulators.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) +3.6% premarket after it agrees to sell all its properties located in...

    Forest Oil (NYSE:FST) +3.6% premarket after it agrees to sell all its properties located in south Louisiana for ~$220M. The properties produced 20 MMcfe/d during Q3 and had estimated proved reserves of 45 Bcfe as of Dec. 31. Upon closing of the transaction, FST intends to update 2012 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • AEZS

    AEterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) -16.6% premarket after the drug development company said it...

    AEterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) -16.6% premarket after the drug development company said it commenced a public offering of units consisting of common shares and warrants to purchase common shares. The size of the offering was not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 5 Comments
  • WFC

    Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC): Q3 EPS of $0.88 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $21.2B misses by $250M....

    Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC): Q3 EPS of $0.88 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $21.2B misses by $250M. Shares -1.4% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM

  • European stocks are mixed in early trading ahead of JPMorgan and Wells Fargo results later...

    European stocks are mixed in early trading ahead of JPMorgan and Wells Fargo results later today, and important Chinese data over the next week, including GDP. Euro Stoxx 50 +0.2%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.1%, Frankfurt -0.2%, Milan +0.4%, Madrid +0.45%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 AM
  • SFTBF

    Softbank (OTCPK:SFTBF) is in negotiations with three major Japanese banks - Mizuho (NYSE:MFG),...

    Softbank (OTCPK:SFTBF) is in negotiations with three major Japanese banks - Mizuho (NYSE:MFG), Sumitomo Mitsui (NYSE:SMFG) and Mitsubishi UFJ (MTU) - about borrowing $23B to fund its bid for Sprint (NYSE:S), Reuters reports. While Sprint is worth $17.3B, it also carries almost $15B of debt. Japanese investors have reacted with dismay to news of the talks, with Softbank's shares closing -17%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 AM | 9 Comments

  • The main Asian stock indexes mostly show little movement ahead of key Chinese data over the next...

    The main Asian stock indexes mostly show little movement ahead of key Chinese data over the next week, including trade, inflation and GDP figures. In Japan, Softbank slumps 17% on news of its talks to buy Sprint. Japan -0.1%, Hong Kong +0.6%, China flat, India -0.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 AM
